venue.address_2: If you do not read the write up- you loose out
venue.name: SEE DETAILS IN EVENT WRITEUP

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

If this kind of event is NOT of interest to you, You do not have to RSVP at all or leave any comment since to me at least-- an absent response is sufficient.

 

If this event is of interest to you -- Please RSVP that you have an interest.

 

Remember, you can go even without a kayak and just socialize with those that are on the beach...just stay away from the person that's eating the free hut dogs like its a Eating Contest.. in 30 minutes you will see what all the talk about Pink Slime is as the person is making like a Human Play Dough Machine...well that's for you to see, im making sure im visually 30 feet away and out of hearing distance.

 

Tom D from the Mass. Paddling Group sent me the info of an event that may be something to do for us.

I tend to not prefer Moonlight or Evening paddle events since you can not see all the nice sights nearby and its usually a short paddle event...But:

However, at times its kind of interesting and Lyons seem to be a good organization hosting it too , its also among possible new people that may choose to be an asset to this paddling group, if not any new members,  its a chance to socialize with fellow paddlers in a setting where you can freely move about and i do not have to keep track of anyone getting lost or finding my equipment to load in the dark.

My calming reason for this listing: Its the Lyons Hosting it and i do not have to keep track of you at all..    8-)~

 

I may bring the full trailer load since there will most likely be an event Saturday Morning, but i do not plan to unload all of them and re-load them for a 2 hour or so event.. so bring your own kayak is my most likely  suggestion for some of you.

Ok, onto the details:

As best as i can see the exact address is:

21 Lyons Road, Stafford Springs CT

 

http://www.bing.com/maps/?FORM=MLOMAP&PUBL=GOOGLE&CREA=userid1743gobroadfphumem2khvlw7ml8dkb3h3kcgsoxz1369#JnE9LjIxJTJibHlvbnMlMmJyb2FkJTI1MmMlMmJzdGFmZm9yZCUyNTJjJTJiY3QlN2Vzc3QuMCU3ZXBnLjEmYmI9NDEuOTk2NDc3MTkzMzc5MiU3ZS03Mi4yNTY3NDM0MjkzNzMxJTdlNDEuOTkzMDQyMDA4MTQyNSU3ZS03Mi4yNjAxNjE2MzMyODA2

 

 

Stafford Lions Club Connecticut - United States

MOONLIGHT PADDLE - AUGUST 2012

 

When:   Friday, August 24, 2012

Time:    Gate will open at 6:30 and launch at 7:30 pm

Where:  Staffordville Lake, Rt 19, Staffordville, CT
(behind Staffordville School)

Fun:      Free Paddling, (bring your own canoe or kayak)
Free Hotdogs and Snacks

Raffle:  Grand Prize - Kayak package, includes  Kayak, paddle and PFD
Tickets available for $5 each

For more information please contact Jerry Baggish at jbaggish@msn.com or 860-684-5367

Moonlight Paddle Pictures

Lion Gary and Kayak Package Raffle Winner

Lions are an international network of 1.3 million men and women in 205 countries and geographic areas who work together to answer the needs that challenge communities around the world.
item.how_to_find_us: i will be wearing my Orange Hunting Hat on the beach or water.
